business.headline: Credit card EMIs: Smart tool or hidden cost?Credit card EMIs have become a common way to manage big purchases, but are they truly a smart budgeting tool or just another expense disguised as convenience?

Good news on India–US trade deal once it's fair and equitable, says Piyush GoyalSpeaking at the Indo-US Economic Summit organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce in New Delhi, Piyush Goyal said negotiations are moving ahead, but a final announcement will come only when the terms are acceptable and mutually beneficial.

What is the 9-9-6 work culture Narayana Murthy wants Indians to learn from?In his latest remarks, Murthy referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 working culture, a system followed by many Chinese tech companies during their rapid growth phase.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we decode what the number really means for policyholders.
Sensex ends 325 points lower, Nifty closes below 26,000; IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 324.96 points to close at 84,625.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 103.40 points to end at 25,910.05.
Fujiyama Power Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusApplicants can now check whether they have received shares through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Rs 5,000 SIP vs Rs 60,000 lump sum: Which creates more wealth in 10 years?Is it wiser to invest Rs 5,000 every month, or does a yearly Rs 60,000 lump sum genuinely create more wealth in the long run? We explore the answer here.
Excelsoft Technologies IPO Opens on November 19: Check GMP and price bandFounded in 2000, Excelsoft Technologies is known for its tech-led solutions in the education and assessment industry.

Why chasing every new IPO can hurt your portfolioChasing every new IPO may feel exciting, but it often does more harm than good. Many recent listings have slipped below their issue price, showing that hype doesn't always translate into real returns.

PhysicsWallah shares up 40% over IPO price: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, giving investors a 33% premium over the issue price of Rs 109. This opening surprised market participants, as the GMP trend had pointed to only a mild gain ahead of the listing.

Has your tax refund been delayed? CBDT chief explains whyIf you're still waiting for your income-tax refund, you're not alone. The CBDT chief has clarified why some payouts are taking longer this year and what the department is doing to speed things up.

Digital gold firms knock on Sebi's door, seek regulatory supervision: ReportWith digital gold gaining traction across India, questions around safety and regulation are becoming louder. Industry bodies and platforms now want formal oversight to boost trust in the fast-growing segment.

PhysicsWallah makes strong market debut as shares list at 33% premiumPhysicsWallah share price: The stock listed at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, marking a sharp 33% premium over its issue price of Rs 109.

Narayana Murthy now cites Chinese 9-9-6 system to back 72-hour work week callIn a recent interview, the 79-year-old billionaire referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 work culture to support his long-held view that young Indians should work longer hours to help India grow faster.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade amid a cautious start on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136 points to 84,814.95 around 9:34 am, while the Nifty50 fell 49.95 points to 25,963.50. Sectoral indices were mixed, reflecting the cautious tone among investors.

Why gold, silver prices are falling today and what to expect nextIn India, gold and silver prices also reflected this weakness. As of Tuesday morning, 24-karat gold was priced at Rs 12,343 per gram and Rs 1,23,430 per 10 grams.

PhysicsWallah IPO listing: GMP bounces back, but will investors actually gain?Despite the company's strong brand presence and loyal student base, its IPO received a modest subscription, suggesting that investor sentiment remains cautious.

You're applying for IPOs. But are you funding growth or just promoter exits?The IPO market looks hotter than ever, but the rise of OFS-led offerings reveals a trend most retail investors rarely pause to examine. In Part 2 of The Great IPO Gamble series, we break down what's changing beneath the hype.

US says sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil already cutting Russia's oil revenueThe US Treasury says sanctions on Russian oil majors are lowering revenues and sales. The two largest buyers of Russian oil have been China and India.

Is it possible to improve your credit score without owning a card?Many people assume that a credit card is essential for building a good credit score. But experts say that's not true. With the right financial habits and timely repayments, you can strengthen your credit profile even without owning a card.

entertainment.headline: Aditya Dhar praises crew's long hours as Dhurandhar trailer launches Aditya Dhar praised the 'Dhurandhar' team for working 16-18 hours daily during the shoot. The trailer launch highlighted the film's intense action and the crew's dedication amid industry debates on work hours.

BLACKPINK's Jisoo talks perfect love and moving on from Ahn Bo Hyun split Singer Jisoo shares her perspectives on love and self-care after ending her public relationship, while preparing for BLACKPINK's upcoming music and ongoing world tour.

Co-Ed trailer: Rajeshwari, Varun star in drama about a school in midst of chaos The trailer for the upcoming Amazon MX Player series 'Co-Ed', starring Rajeshwari Sachdev, Varun Badola, Vedant Sinha and Adrija Sinha, has been released. It offers a look at the merging of two Udaipur schools and the ensuing drama.

Complaint against SS Rajamouli over Lord Hanuman remarks at Varanasi event Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's remark about Lord Hanuman at the title launch of his new film have sparked debate and concern, with several groups calling for action in response to his comments. A police complaint has been filed against him in Hyderabad.
Dinesh Vijan announces seven new horror-comedies after Stree 2, Thamma Dinesh Vijan announces major expansion of Maddock Films' horror-comedy slate, outlines technology's impact on filmmaking.

Penn Badgley says he and wife Domino Kirke nearly divorced after 2 miscarriages Actor Penn Badgley shares how successive miscarriages nearly led to separation from his wife, Domino Kirke, and reflects on their experience of isolation, eventual family growth, and the need for greater openness about pregnancy loss.

Delhi Crime 3 director clarifies why Richie Mehta's name is still on the credits In an exclusive interview with India Today, 'Delhi Crime 3' director spoke about why the show's creator, Richie Mehta's name is still there on the credits.

After The Hunt Trailer: Julia Roberts, Andrew Garfield walk into a moral minefield Director Luca Guadagnino and actor Julia Roberts will receive the Gotham Awards Visionary Tribute, while their film After The Hunt is set for global streaming debut.

When Manoj Bajpayee locked himself in washroom to avoid meeting Amitabh Bachchan Manoj Bajpayee revisits his first meeting with Amitabh Bachchan during 'Satya' screening. The actor shares an emotional encounter and a special hug on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'.

Internet reacts to Dhurandhar trailer: Dear CBFC, don't mess up this time The trailer for the upcoming film 'Dhurandhar', headlined by Ranveer Singh, has sparked a flurry of reactions on social media. With its depiction of intense violence, users are both praising the film's style and expressing concern over its content.

120 Bahadur director Razneesh Ghai details film's intense 6-year prep In an exclusive interview with India Today, director Raneesh Ghai opened up about the massive effort behind bringing one of the world's most defining battles to screen with the upcoming film '120 Bahadur.'

How The Running Man Glen Powell just missed the bus to Hollywood top lot. For now Actor Glen Powell's Hollywood ascent hits a new roadblock as his new film, 'The Running Man', loses to 'Now You See Me' in the box office race, and earns mixed reviews, raising questions about his project choices

Javed Akhtar had tears after watching 120 Bahadur, reveals Farhan Akhtar Farhan Akhtar revealed his father Javed Akhtar was deeply moved by '120 Bahadur'. The film is based on the Battle of Rezang La and is set to release on November 21.

Ocean's 9 Juhu beach edition ft shirtless Akshay Kumar, Tiger Shroff. Watch Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff, joined by a group dubbed the 'Desi Boys,' captured public attention during a recent walk along Mumbai's Juhu Beach. The group, led by Kumar, drew significant reactions online for their fitness and camaraderie, as highlighted in a widely shared video.

Vilaayath Budha to Mask: 9 South films to hit theatres on November 21 As many as nine South Indian films are arriving in theaters this week, spanning the Malayalam, Telugu, Tamil, and Kannada languages. Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'Vilaayath Budha' and Kavin-Andrea Jeremiah's 'Mask' are among the films that are due for release.

Actor Elli AvrRam says OTT helped break years of Bollywood stereotyping Elli AvrRam opened up about being stereotyped for years in Bollywood due to her appearance, with many assuming she couldn't speak Hindi. She said OTT platforms finally helped filmmakers see her range and break the typecast image.

Dhurandhar trailer: Ranveer Singh's film unleashes gruesome war against terrorism Ranveer Singh shines in the high-octane 'Dhurandhar' trailer, as the Aditya Dhar film teases a violent, action-heavy battle drama with a powerful ensemble cast. The trailer introduces a revenge-driven plot rooted in India–Pakistan tensions.

Nayanthara reunites with Balakrishna after 7 years in NBK 111, to play a queen On November 18, the makers of 'NBK 111' confirmed that actor Nayanthara will play the role of a queen in the upcoming period drama directed by Gopichand Malineni. The announcement also marks a reunion for Nayanthara and Nandamuri Balakrishna after several years.

Ranveer's Dhurandhar could be a two-part film, echoing Ramayana plan: Report Ranveer Singh's upcoming film 'Dhurandhar' is reportedly a two-part spy thriller. The first part is scheduled for release on December 5, 2025. The second instalment is likely to arrive in the first half of the following year.

general news.headline: Forget politics, I'll leave Bihar: Smarting, Prashant Kishor dares JD(U) againPrashant Kishor said he would "definitely quit politics" if the Nitish Kumar-led NDA government fulfils its poll promise of giving Rs 2 lakh each to 1.5 crore women. Rejecting claims that he plans to exit after Jan Suraaj's defeat, Kishor said he will stay in Bihar and intensify his campaign.

X aka Twitter and ChatGPT down along with some other websites, Cloudflare glitchingThe social media platform X, formerly Twitter, is currently down. The outage seems to be affecting multiple sites and is related to issues with internet infrastructure service Cloudfare.

Bihar Speaker's post settled, JD(U) adamant on retaining Home, say sourcesThe main contention is over the Home Department, which Nitish Kumar has held so far. Earlier, sources said both the JDU and BJP were eyeing the Speaker's post, with the BJP keen to retain it. However, allies now show no disagreement over the Speaker's position.

India rolls out next-gen e-passports: A look at key security upgradesIndia is rolling out next-generation e-passports with advanced security features and RFID chips under the upgraded Passport Seva Programme 2.0.

Hasina's downfall: Irony of Bangladesh's cycle of power, justice, aversion to loyaltySheikh Hasina's death sentence symbolises Bangladesh's tragic cycle of power, vengeance, and rewritten history. It is a metaphor for a nation caught between its bloody past and uncertain future, where justice and politics collide endlessly.

Behind top Maoist Hidma's killing, a story of split, betrayal and dogged huntMadvi Hidma's death in a counter-insurgency operation signals the near-collapse of the Maoist insurgency in India. Hidma, one of the top Maoist commanders, hid from security forces even as he masterminded brutal killings. A split among Maoists and the back-to-back operations against Left-Wing Extremism is what got him killed.

Free India from Macaulay's slavery mindset: PM Modi sets 10-year roadmapPrime Minister Narendra Modi urged a national resolve to shed what he called the "Macaulay mindset," launching a 10-year mission to reverse the colonial-era impact of the 1835 education overhaul.

Suicide bombing very misunderstood, says Red Fort bomber in unseen videoIn the unseen footage, the Red Fort bomber talks about the "misunderstood" concept of suicide bombing. He explains that what is often labelled as a suicide bombing is actually a martyrdom operation in Islam.

Why modern marriages need maintenance, not expiry datesThe latest debate taking over the internet is whether marriages should come with an expiry and renewal date — all thanks to Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's show 'Two Much'.

Shashi Tharoor braves cold and cough to attend PM's lecture, offers fresh praiseCongress MP Shashi Tharoor observed that PM Modi's message resonated as both an economic assessment and a cultural directive, encouraging citizens to strive for national improvement.

H-1B petitions by Indian companies fall, Amazon, Meta top 2025 listH-1B visa petitions by Indian companies in FY 2025 dropped by 37% compared to last year's numbers. The drop is a significant 70% compared to a decade ago. US tech giants, Amazon, Meta, Microsoft, and Google, dominated new H-1B approvals.

Pak's repair work, even after 6 months, shows how hard India hitIt has been over six months since India and Pakistan engaged in a four-day war, yet Pakistan has not been able to repair the damage inflicted by Indian forces on its vital installations. OSINT expert Damien Symon's revelations of repairs at the Nur Khan Airbase poke big holes in Pakistan's claims of victory against India in the May conflict.
Bhajan Clubbing goes big, and it's selling out like a concertDon't be surprised if the next sold-out rant on social media isn't about a Coldplay concert, but a bhajan-clubbing night.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Irony dies twice as Jamaat cheers Hasina's BhasmasuraA double irony unfolded as the International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) of Bangladesh gave ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina the death sentence. The ICT was set up by Hasina herself to try those accused of 1971 war crimes. The Jamaat-e-Islami, which lauded the ICT verdict, had the most number of leaders hanged by the tribunal.

Watch: Japan's Sakurajima volcano explodes, sends ash 4 km in the airThis marked the first time in nearly 13 months that the volcano's ash plume had reached above 4 kilometers, reflecting a notably intense eruption compared to recent activity.

Javed Akhtar had tears after watching 120 Bahadur, reveals Farhan AkhtarFarhan Akhtar revealed his father Javed Akhtar was deeply moved by '120 Bahadur'. The film is based on the Battle of Rezang La and is set to release on November 21.

Pak rapper Talha Anjum waves Indian flag, tells critics he'll do it againPakistani rapper Talha Anjum has ignited a controversy after draping an Indian flag around his shoulders during his Kathmandu concert. His waving the Tricolour and draping it were seen as provocative by many. He was singing his diss track 'Kaun Talha' aimed at Indian Gully Gang rapper Naezy when an Indian flag was thrown at him. Anjum caught the flag mid-air and waved it.

Who is Vikram Bajaj, co-CEO with Jeff Bezos in his AI company? All answers hereVikram Bajaj is co-CEO of a new AI company called Project Prometheus. That is not the interesting part though. The interesting part is that Project Prometheus is a company co-founded by Jeff Bezos, who is the other CEO there. So, who really is Vikram Bajaj?

Trump backs release of Epstein Files. What's behind this U-turn?In a surprise U-turn, US President Donald Trump has asked House Republicans to vote for the release of the Epstein Files. This is what led to Trump's change of stance on the documents linked to the convicted paedophile and trafficker.

Why most Indians blame global warming for extreme weather eventsOver 70% of Indians in all districts say that global warming is causing severe heat waves. To better understand this, we conducted phone interviews with over 19,000 people between 2022 and 2025. Here is what we found.

Delhi blast co-conspirator had backed out of suicide bombing: Suicide is sinA political science student, Bilal had been radicalised for suicide bombing since 2023 by Umar, arrested doctors revealed during interrogation.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we decode what the number really means for policyholders.

Why Trump is gifting F-35 jets to Saudi ArabiaDonald Trump surprised one and all by announcing that he would approve the sale of F-35 jets to Saudi Arabia. So far, Israel is the only country in the Middle East to have the jet. What's behind Trump's move?

Priyanka Chopra enjoys a quiet Goa break after Varanasi event in Hyderabad. PicsPriyanka Chopra enjoyed a short break in Goa after the high-octane 'Varanasi' event in Hyderabad. She shared moments of her stay and expressed her fondness for the city on Instagram.

Aditya Dhar praises crew's long hours as Dhurandhar trailer launchesAditya Dhar praised the 'Dhurandhar' team for working 16-18 hours daily during the shoot. The trailer launch highlighted the film's intense action and the crew's dedication amid industry debates on work hours.

sports.headline: India bring in ambidextrous spinner to deal with South Africa spin threat in Guwahati IND vs SA: India roped in ambidextrous Bengal spinner Kaushik Maity for specialised match-simulation training to help their batters prepare for South Africa's potent spin attack ahead of the second Test in Guwahati.

Karim Benzema comes in support of Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr: He's phenomenal Karim Benzema has come to the defence of Vinicius Jr amid rising criticism in Spain. The former Real Madrid striker believes the Brazilian is being judged too harshly and still has the potential to reach even greater heights.

Saina Nehwal and Peter Gade reunite in Delhi to inspire badminton's next generation Badminton icons Saina Nehwal and Peter Gade will headline the Legends' Vision – Legacy Tour India as the initiative returns to Delhi after eight years. The two-day event brings legends, juniors and fans together, highlighted by a racquet donation drive aimed at widening access to the sport.

Manu Bhaker after ISSF World Championships failure: You can't win everyday Manu Bhaker reflected on her medal-less World Championships campaign, praising Esha Singh's bronze while acknowledging her own dip in form and stressing that setbacks are part of sport.

Even Tendulkar or Kohli won't survive on current Indian pitches: Harbhajan Singh Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has slammed Indian pitches, saying that batting stalwarts like Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli wouldn't be able to survive on such surfaces.

Kolkata Test star says Temba Bavuma didn't get what he deserved after heroic knock IND vs SA, 1st Test: South Africa off-spinner Simon Harmer believes captain Temba Bavuma deserved Player of the Match in the first Test against India. Bavuma's gritty fifty and a key catch were pivotal in South Africa's historic win in Kolkata.

James Anderson's Ashes wake-up call: Not just pace, England need to be relentless James Anderson advises England's fast bowlers to combine pace with accuracy for Ashes success. He highlights Ben Stokes' role and warns that relentlessness, not just speed, will decide the series outcome.

Marnus Labuschagne fires warning to England bowlers ft Jofra Archer ahead of Ashes Australia's Marnus Labuschagne has issued a sharp warning to England's fast bowlers ahead of the Ashes. With Jofra Archer back in the mix, the Australian batter believes he's in his best form since their dramatic 2019 duel.

Bangladesh Women's tour of India postponed amid political tensions: Reports Bangladesh's women's cricket tour of India has been postponed, with both boards citing scheduling pressures amid heightened political tensions. The two teams were scheduled to play three ODIs and three T20Is in December.

Babar Azam breaks silence to ex-Pakistan captain on pain of personal attacks Former Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja lifted the lid on a private conversation with Babar Azam, saying the superstar batter expressed his frustration over personal attacks. Babar ended an 807-day wait for an international hundred earlier this month.

Kolkata Test star says Temba Bavuma didn't get what he deserved after heroic knock IND vs SA, 1st Test: South Africa off-spinner Simon Harmer believes captain Temba Bavuma deserved Player of the Match in the first Test against India. Bavuma's gritty fifty and a key catch were pivotal in South Africa's historic win in Kolkata.

James Anderson's Ashes wake-up call: Not just pace, England need to be relentless James Anderson advises England's fast bowlers to combine pace with accuracy for Ashes success. He highlights Ben Stokes' role and warns that relentlessness, not just speed, will decide the series outcome.

Marnus Labuschagne fires warning to England bowlers ft Jofra Archer ahead of Ashes Australia's Marnus Labuschagne has issued a sharp warning to England's fast bowlers ahead of the Ashes. With Jofra Archer back in the mix, the Australian batter believes he's in his best form since their dramatic 2019 duel.

Bangladesh Women's tour of India postponed amid political tensions: Reports Bangladesh's women's cricket tour of India has been postponed, with both boards citing scheduling pressures amid heightened political tensions. The two teams were scheduled to play three ODIs and three T20Is in December.

Babar Azam breaks silence to ex-Pakistan captain on pain of personal attacks Former Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja lifted the lid on a private conversation with Babar Azam, saying the superstar batter expressed his frustration over personal attacks. Babar ended an 807-day wait for an international hundred earlier this month.

Heartbroken Carlos Alcaraz pulls out of Davis Cup due to hamstring injuryCarlos Alcaraz withdrew from the Davis Cup Finals with a hamstring injury but still finished the season as the year-end world No.1 after a consistently dominant 2025 campaign.

Jason Gillespie on Kolkata Test row: Hosts must stay out of pitch preparationJason Gillespie has urged for full freedom for cricket pitch curators without host nation influence. The Kolkata pitch came under the scanner after India's loss against South Africa inside three days.

Tuchel plans talks with sidelined players over England recall before World CupThomas Tuchel will meet with omitted England players to clarify selection choices ahead of the 2026 FIFA World Cup. England remain unbeaten and without conceding in Group K, as Tuchel prepares for another training camp before final squad decisions.

PAK vs SL: Babar Azam reprimanded by ICC after striking the stumps in 3rd ODIBabar Azam has been fined and given a demerit point for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct during the third ODI against Sri Lanka. The Pakistan star struck the stumps after his dismissal but accepted the penalty. The sanction comes despite his strong batting performance in the series.

IND vs SA: Nitish Reddy joins team in Guwahati as cover for injured Shubman GillIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been added as a cover to the squad for the injured captain Shubman Gill ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati.

Alex Carey not buying into Barmy Army truce, years after Bairstow stumping rowAlex Carey is not convinced about the Barmy Army keeping quiet during the Ashes series in Perth. He remains focused on his game despite anticipating a hostile crowd atmosphere.

Medvedev, Kyrgios, Rybakina to headline World Tennis League's India debutWorld Tennis League is set to make its India debut in Bengaluru in December. Some of the biggest names in tennis, including Daniil Medvedev, Nick Kyrgios, and Elena Rybakina, are expected to compete in the event.

No restrictions: Cameron Green ready to be unleashed as a bowler in Ashes 2025Cameron Green has said that he will be bowling without any restrictions during the Ashes 2025 series against England. Green has returned to action in the Sheffield Shield and was seen slowly getting up to speed with the ball.

IND vs SA: Nitish Reddy joins team in Guwahati as cover for injured Shubman GillIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been added as a cover to the squad for the injured captain Shubman Gill ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati.

Alex Carey not buying into Barmy Army truce, years after Bairstow stumping rowAlex Carey is not convinced about the Barmy Army keeping quiet during the Ashes series in Perth. He remains focused on his game despite anticipating a hostile crowd atmosphere.

Medvedev, Kyrgios, Rybakina to headline World Tennis League's India debutWorld Tennis League is set to make its India debut in Bengaluru in December. Some of the biggest names in tennis, including Daniil Medvedev, Nick Kyrgios, and Elena Rybakina, are expected to compete in the event.

No restrictions: Cameron Green ready to be unleashed as a bowler in Ashes 2025Cameron Green has said that he will be bowling without any restrictions during the Ashes 2025 series against England. Green has returned to action in the Sheffield Shield and was seen slowly getting up to speed with the ball.

Golf over practice? Aussie media mock Stokes's England before 1st Ashes TestEngland's Ashes preparations have come under scrutiny after players were seen golfing ahead of the Perth Test. Ben Stokes-led side played only one warm-up match before the series opener, starting February 21 in Perth.

Tore shreds off me: Australia's Khawaja on first encounter with Brendon McCullumAustralia opener Usman Khawaja revealed how his first encounter with England coach Brendon McCullum wasn't a pleasant experience. Khawaja said that the former New Zealand wicketkeeper sledged him mercilessly in 2011.

Indian archers stuck in Dhaka for 10 hours: Forced into unsafe, filthy accommodationIndian archers endured a chaotic return from Dhaka after a cancelled flight left them stranded for nearly 10 hours and forced into filthy, unsafe accommodation without any airline support. The ordeal unfolded amid violence in the Bangladeshi capital, putting several minors and women athletes at risk.

England need to win first two Tests to have a chance of winning Ashes: Stuart BroadFormer England cricketer Stuart Broad believes that the first two Tests will be key for the side's chances to break Australia's Ashes dominance.

Guwahati Test: Ex-India batter says CSK captain should replace Gill if he's ruled outIndia vs South Africa: Aakash Chopra has recommended Ruturaj Gaikwad as a replacement if Shubman Gill is ruled out of the second Test in Guwahati. India fielded as many as six left-handers in the first Test in Kolkata, which they lost by 30 runs.

PAK vs ZIM vs SL T20I tri-series: Livestreaming details and all you need to knowPakistan will welcome Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka to Rawalpindi for a T20I tri-series as both teams aim to gain momentum heading into the T20 World Cup next year. All the matches will be played at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

BAN vs IND: When and where to watch Ryan Williams' debut for Indian football teamThe latest entry to the Blue Tigers, OCI star Ryan Williams, could make his much-anticipated debut for the Indian football team as India takes on Bangladesh. Here's a quick guide on when the match kicks off and where fans can watch the action live.

Shock defeat spurs India to training in Kolkata before Guwahati tripIndia vs South Africa: India players and members of the support staff, led by coach Gautam Gambhir, trained at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, getting in a solid hit in the nets. They made the most of the extra days available after the first Test ended inside two-and-a-half days, with the hosts losing by 30 runs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
